know  that  there  are  all  sorts  of
things it hasn’t done. Apparently Intelligence isn’t directed toward elimi-
nating  the  junk  from  genomes  or  removing  vestigial  structures  like  the
whale’s pelvis or generating radically new arrangements for mammalian
forelimbs. It’s possible, of course, that although directed toward these ends,
Intelligence is simply unable to bring them about. So any satisfactory prin-
ciples  must  differentiate  between  the  bacterial  flagellum,  blood-clot
